inn1.comm: begins with a loosener outside off stump, good length, no real movement, but good carry to the 'keeper as the batsman leaves it be
and again, a good length delivery well outside off stump, which Porterfield leaves be
third in a row, outside off stump, good carry to Rahim, Porterfield isnt interested
there's the straighter one on off stump, pitching and kicking up to surprise Porterfield as he gets forward, copping one on the glove
good bounce, landing shorter outside off stump and Porterfield just manages to withdraw the bat as the ball zips past him
good stuff there, landing on a good length outside off stump and seaming into Rahim's gloves as Porterfield holds back on the shot again
good start, good length on leg stump, Bray tries to flick but gets an inside-edge onto the back leg, some inswing from the bowler
full on leg stump, again good late swing, batsman looks to flick and manages leg-byes to short fine leg, Ashraful
straight on about middle and off, he gets over it and flicks in the gap between square leg and midwicket, Ashraful gives chase and the batsmen run three
back of a length on and around off stump, swings into Bray, who jams it down to third man, well played
strives for length, ends up bowling a low full toss on off stump, which Porterfield cant put away, hits it straight to midwicket
good, quick delivery starts outside off and then swings in, catching Bray by surprise, but he gets bat on it and the inside-edge swings past leg stump
short of a length outside leg stump, easy pickings for the batsman to flick it down to fine leg for a run
good length on about middle and leg stump, swings in as Bray lunges forward, gets struck on high above the knee roll but Bowden rules it would've gone over the stumps
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
good length outside off stump, Bray lunges forward and defends to cover, telling his partner not to think about the single
back of a length outside off stump, defended off the front foot to cover
short of a length on the stumps, Bray turns it towards square leg in the air
yorker outside leg stump, wide is the call, duly
good length outside off stump, Porterfield gets forward and gently pushes to mid-off, calling for the single

this one rears off the surface from back of a length, catching Bray on the arm as he looks to hold the bat back, the ball rolls to the off side and Bashar clumsily throws the ball at the stumps and gives away a run
good stuff, right up there on off stump and Porterfield gets forward in defence
good length, moving away from off stump, he gets forward in defence, and the thick edge scoots along the ground past a very deep second slip and escapes to the ropes
fullish outside leg stump, he looks to flick but misses out
dropped! Was a no-ball anyways, but still, Porterfield lunges forward and drives one in the air to a diving Razzak at cover, who gets to it and then lets it pop out
full on off stump, Porterfield gets well over it to counter the swing and clips it through midwicket for runs
back of a length, deviates in from outside off stump and he defends it to cover off the back foot
strays to leg stump, works it to square leg for a quick single
back of a length marginally outside off stump, Bray's feet go nowhere fast as he flings the bat at it, one-handed, and misses
good length, fuller this time, he lunges forward and gets hit on the pad well outside the line of impact, no appeal from anyone
short of a length outside off stump, Bray goes back and reaches for it, placing it wide of backward point and picking up two
fuller now, and he lunges forward again and pushes to point
from around the wicket, full and furious, slipping down leg stump but Shahadat goes up in appeal, the answer is a casual shake of the head from Steve Bucknor
full outside off stump now, pitching and swinging in at a good pace as Porterfield leaves it alone
full and honing into off stump, working up good pace and looking for the yorker, defended back to him with confidence
back of a good length just outside off stump, Porterfield gets up and nudges it to the leg side
back of a length well outside off stump, left alone
good length outside off stump, he gets over it and defends to the on side
back of a length on the stumps, Bray stands up and defends it to the off side
back of a length just outside off stump, Bray gets bat and pad together and jams it to the off again
identical length again on off stump, he gets half-forward and pushes to cover
oversteps this time, landing the ball full on leg stump and Bray defends it back to him
lands on a good length outside off stump and seams away into Rahim's gloves after Bray leaves it alone
good length on off stump and he manages to just get bat down on it, would've been an interesting call if he'd missed
back of a length on leg stump, turned straight to Ashraful at square leg
good length ball moving in from outside off stump, defended back to him

full outside off stump, he walks into the shot and flicks across the line to Ashraful at midwicket, who dives to stop it and injures the little finger on his left hand in the process, not a clean take and the ball runs away behind him
back of a length outside off stump, defended
full outside off stump and moving in, Porterfield gets over it and turns to midwicket

back of a length moving in from outside off stump, nicely turns it through square leg out to Mortaza coming around from fine leg, collecting and throwing it back in good time to cut off any ideas of a third run
back of a length on off stump, pushed softly to mid-on and Porterfield calls for the quick single
good length moving away from off stump, another no ball, a freebie, as Porterfield defends off the front foot
back of a length on middle and off, defended to midwicket
back of a length again on middle and off, gets up and defends it back to the bowler
good stop! Was full, Porterfield pushed it back hard to Mortaza's left, and he dives on the move and cuts it off
quick ball, back of a length on off stump, he pokes at it and gets an edge that flies fast but lands well before a diving second slip
back of a length on off stump, Bray stands and defends to cover
good ball, right on the stumps, forcing Bray to lunge forward and defend to Ferhad Reza at cover
nips in off a length outside off stump, striking him high on the knee roll and the ball was doing too much, would've missed the top of leg
back of a length coming in with the angle, he stands behind the line and defends it down the track
bangs in one short outside off stump, Porterfield gives it the kitchen sink, swivelling through in his attempted pull, but he's too late on the shot
short of a length angled into the ribs, but Porterfield's up to the challenge, turning it off the hips to short fine leg for one
good length outside off stump, he lunges forward and gets hit on the front leg, but well outside the line of impact
good length well outside off stump, he thrusts bat and pad it and the ball rolls to point
back of a length on off stump, driven to mid-on
short of a length outside off stump, Bray stands tall and drives to cover off the back foot
back of a length on middle and off, he swings at it and gets an inside-edge onto the pad, they steal a run and Bowden signals leg-byes
good length outside off stump, Porterfield drives lustily to Bashar at mid-off, sets off and Bashar is too slow in picking up and throwing at the stumps
dragged in short on leg stump, he tries to pull but mistimes the shot to square leg
but thats not mistimed at all! Another long-hop on middle and leg, which Porterfield connects supremely with, pulling hard over square leg for four
good length coming in with the arm from outside off stump, defended back to Shahadat quickly
short ball outside off stump, not too pacy and Bray gets up and manages to chop into the ground and responds to Porterfield's call for the single
good length outside off stump, gets forward and pushes back to the bowler
a tad fuller on off stump, and he turns it in the air in front of midwicket, safely
good length on off stump, turned to the on side
full and swinging in from outside off stump, well clipped through square leg and Raza gives chase to haul it in on a sluggish outfield
tossed up on off stump, he goes back and defends it back
flat on middle and off, he goes back and turns it to square leg for one
fraction width offered outside off stump, Bray gets back and punches in the gap at point and runs hard for three
quicker one outside off stump, he goes back and pushes back to Razzak
tossed up on middle and leg, worked to short fine leg for one
quicker one outside off stump, he gets tangled up in defence, ball almost rolling on after getting stuck in his legs
good length on off stump, turned to midwicket
beaten by a quicker one outside off stump, pitches on a good length and swings past his forward lunge
good length on and around off stump, gets well over it and defends back to Shahadat

short of a length outside off stump, Porterfield cracks it through the gap at cover, again the ball stops in the slow outfield and they get three, but since the bowler's overstepped, make it four to raise the 50
back of a length on leg stump, he turns it to midwicket
banged in short and it just kicks off the surface, catching Bray totally unawares as he hops up, the ball bobs up in the air to leg off the handle and lands safely
slower, fuller outside off stump, he comes forward and defends to cover
tossed up on off stump, Porterfield gets back and across and drives to mid-on
tossed up outside off stump, defended to Razzak
tossed up outside off stump, defended to Razzak again
shorter, flatter, worked off the pads to Aftab at square leg for one
full outside off stump, he comes forward and pushes into the covers for a very quick single
flat on off stump, he gets back and whips it to midwicket
good length outside off stump, raps him on the front leg outside the line, a very, very long and hard appeal from Shahadat is turned down by Bucknor
short of a length angled into the ribs, he goes up on the toes and defends it down to the leg side, Shahadat sprints across the turf to collect
bouncer outside off stump, Bray does a Sehwag, feet going nowhere and flaying the attempted upper cut, connecting with nothing but air
much closer to off stump and again Bray stands there and throws the bat at it, one-handed this time, and gets beaten
overpitched outside off stump and he drives hard in the gap between cover and point for his first boundary
the reply is a canny bouncer outside off stump, Bray sways back and manages to get his head out of the way in time
flat on middle and leg, worked well behind square for an easy couple
quicker one off stump, pushed back down the track
flatter trajectory on off stump, he goes back and drives to Razzak
quicker on middle and off, turned to square leg
tossed up, he uses the feet very well, dancing down and collecting it on the full, freeing the arms and clubbing it down to long-on for four
quicker outside off stump, now he lunges forward and gets beaten
tossed up on off stump, nicely driven to Bashar at cover
flat on middle and off, turned into the midwicket gap and they get one, the fielder is slow in the deep and allows the second
tossed up on a length outside off stump, defended  to cover
tossed up again, nudged to the right of point and he sets off, a direct hit but Porterfield's safe
dropped! Full and flat on off stump, chipped back in the air to his left, he steps across and reaches out, grabs it with his left-hand, and then lets it slip out! Poor cricket
flat on off stump, pushed to mid-on for one
flat and spinning down leg stump, wide called
quick and flat outside off stump, punched back to Razzak
tossed up, he uses the feet well and drives to mid-off
flat and spinning into him, nudged to backward square leg
has a step out, the bowler fires it well wide off stump, batsman cant reach it, wide called
quick and flat outside off stump, he cuts and misses
tossed up outside off stump, pushed back to him
well flighted outside off stump, he comes forward and pulls the bat back as the ball spins away
tossed up outside off stump, driven into the covers for one
tossed up outside off again, flicked across the line to midwicket
tossed up outside off stump, he comes down and sweeps well behind square for one
quicker one, worked to Reza at short midwicket
tossed up on off stump, flicked to mid-on and they set off, Bray is struggling but another chance goes begging, very poor fielding from Bangladesh today
looped up down leg stump, he tries to nudge it to short fine leg and ends up with a leg-bye
tossed up outside off stump, he shuffles across and looks to flick to leg, the ball spits up off a crack and confuses him
flat outside off stump, driven off the back foot to cover
tossed up fuller, he comes onto the front foot and flicks straight to midwicket
tossed up, he goes back and pushes down the track
flighted up, drawing him forward in defence
tossed up outside off stump, Bray comes across and opens the face, running it to backward point
fire up on off stump, he works it into midwicket for an easy couple
tossed up outside off stump, he shuffles across and tries the flick, but mistimes it
flat outside off stump, he comes across and again and now manages to flick it fine for one
tossed up, Porterfield gets over it and defends
quicker and fuller, he comes across and plays across the line, flicking to mid-on
tossed up well outside off stump, he lunges forward and defends
tossed up on off stump, worked out in front of his pads in the air behind square for one
tossed up outside off stump, gets over it and flicks to Tamim at mid-on
quicker one, defended back to Rafique
tossed up outside off stump, he sweeps, misses, gets hit outside the line of impact, and the ball evades Rahim too
much quicker outside off stump and Bray hustles to defend
tossed up, he falls over as he sweeps, gets rapped on the pad, outside off, Rafique appeals and Bowden's not interested
tossed up outside off stump, pushed nervously into the covers and he sets off for a quick single, Rahim gathers and throws at the stumps, and misses...they cant hit anything today!
flat on off stump, flicked behind square and they run hard
quicker outside off stump, he lunges forward and defends
tossed up outside off stump, driven back to him
looped up on off stump, Bray works it across the line to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, he gets down and paddle-sweeps out to fine leg
flat on middle and leg, worked into the on side
tossed up on off stump, he uses the feet and flicks to midwicket
short and flat, he goes back and punches to cover
tossed up outside off stump, driven off the front foot to cover this time
tossed up on off stump, uses the feet and flicks wide of mid-on
quicker on off stump, he shuffles across and just manages to get bat down on it
tossed up, he lunges forward in defence
tossed up on off stump, he comes out and chips it down to long-on

tossed up, he comes out and drives towards mid-off, Saqibul dives across and gets a hand to it, batsman calls for the run, looking for his 50, Bray is struggling, it was a bad call, and finally a throw hits the stumps
tossed up on off stump, defended

dropped!, and Morgan's not wasting time! Comes down the track second ball, chips in the air over midwicket, the ball sails down to Shahadat, who doesnt judge it standing well inside the ropes, he backpeddles and lets it go over his head
quicker on off stump, defended back down the track
tossed up on middle and off, Porterfield drives down to long-on and gets to his 50, well played
flat outside off stump, driven back to Rafique
quick and flat on off stump, defended
again quick on off and Morgan drives back to Rafique
tossed up well outside off stump and beats him
full on off stump and he drives back to him again
flat on middle and off, flicked out to deep midwicket for a couple
tossed up outside off stump, turned to square leg
comes out, he sees it and fires it wide, batsman has to check his shot
tossed up outside off stump, he sweeps, misses, and steals a leg-bye to point to bring up the 100

flat outside off stump, he shuffles across and flicks wide past midwicket, they run the first hard but on the second they're struggling, a good, low throw comes in from Shahadat in the deep, Rahim collects it very low in front of the stumps and just does the needful! Bangladesh have now affected two quick run outs after missing everything all morning, and Morgan's disappointing tournament continues
tossed up outside off stump, he comes forward and defends
tossed up on off stump, turned to midwicket
tossed up outside off stump again, swept to short fine leg
flat on off stump, flicked to Aftab at midwicket for one
fired down leg stump
tossed up on off stump, flicked in the air backward of square
tossed up again and its nudged to short fine leg this time
tossed up, he shimmies down the track and drives to mid-on for one
comes out, he sees it and fires it wider, and he has to defend it
tossed up, he sweeps, gets a top-edge, but its safely over short fine leg
tossed up on off stump, he turns it around the corner to Aftab at short fine leg for one
tossed up outside off stump, nicely turned around the corner again to keep Aftab busy
short and wide, he gets into position and cuts wide of backward point, then sprints two
flat on off stump, flicked to Reza at midwicket
tossed up, edged, and the ball runs down to third man, batsmen get two
spins down leg stump, worked off the pads wide of Bashar at short fine leg for a single
flatter trajectory this time, outside off stump, punched back to the bowler
tossed up, flicked to midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, turned to Bashar at short fine leg
tossed up, he comes out of the box and whips it to square leg
tossed up on off stump, worked off into the midwicket region
quicker outside off stump, pushed gently into the covers for one off the back foot
spins in off a length, he adjusts and chops off the back foot in front of point
tossed up outside off stump, he plays for turn and gets beaten, Rahim whips off the bails but the back leg was in
flat outside off stump, he gets down and sweeps hard through square for the easiest of twos, a poor fumble on the ropes allowed the second
tossed up again, worked past square for one more
begins with a loosener on the pads, nudged around the corner for one
good length on middle and off, played courtesy the inside-edge to midwicket
good length on off stump, played back to Aftab
back of a length outside off stump, played softly in front of point for one
fuller on middle and off, turned to midwicket for one
good length on middle and leg, turned to square leg
short and wide, cut into the covers for an easy single

good catch! Tossed up, he quickly gets into position to play the reverse sweep, connects very well off the middle of the bat, but Tamim flings himself forward at short third man and holds onto it firmly
tossed up, defended
quicker one on off stump, defended
tossed up again, and he taps it back down the pitch
tossed up again, and yes, you guessed it, he defends it back
short of a length outside off stump, driven into the covers for one
back of a length outside off stump, he drives into the point region to open his account
fuller on off stump this time, driven down to long-on for another
slower one outside off stump, O'Brien drives and misses all ends up
quicker one now, he stands and attempts the late dab but again is beaten
quite far away from outside off stump and wide is the call
nips back in off the seam and O'Brien nudges it calmly to mid-on for one
flat on off stump, driven off the back foot to mid-on
short outside off stump, cut off the back foot out to deep point
tossed up on middle and off, defended to the on side
looped up outside off stump, he sweeps and gets hit outside the line
drifts down leg stump, turned right to Aftab at short fine leg
quick and flat on middle and off, turned into the midwicket region, calls for the quick single, his partner is struggling, a good flat throw comes in O'Brien's just made it in
short outside off stump, driven to point
tossed up outside off stump, driven past point for the single
tossed up on leg stump, tickled fine for a quick single
comes out, fires it in quick and full, and Porterfield drives back to Razzak
short and flat, he tries to pull but mistimes it into the ground for one
quick, short, wide, cut into the covers
back of a length outside off stump, cut to point
tossed up, he comes out and flicks to Rajin Saleh at short fine leg, who fumbles
slow and low on off stump, comes out and drives to long-on
tossed up outside off stump, swept straight to Saleh again
tossed up outside off stump, slog-swept out to Mortaza at deep midwicket
flat outside off stump, flicked across the line to square leg for one

comes out of the track, bowler drops it short, he swings across the line, misses, the ball rolls off his pads back to Razzak, who throws back to the stumps, misses, Bashar at short fine leg doesnt back up and thats the easiest two runs ever
back of a length, pushed to cover
shot! Comes out, gets to the pitch, and carts it down to long-on for four
short and wide, he cuts this time out to the man on the ropes
quick on middle and leg, nudged out to deep backward square
hammered for maximum! O'Brien shimmies down the track, collects one on the pads full, and sends it over cow corner, impressive stroke
tossed up on off stump, he drives down past the bowler to long-on, O'Brien wants strike
quick outside off stump, he tries the dab but gets beaten
tossed up outside off stump, O'Brien leans into a nice-looking drive past the covers and mid-off for two
short and flat and its cut past mid-off for one
comes out, collecting one fuller and flicking into square leg to give O'Brien strike
short and wide, cracked off the back foot out to the man in the deep and he will regain strike
tossed up, he comes down and flicks to deep mid-on
tossed up, uses the feet well and drives past mid-on, on the circle, out to the man moving around from long-on, well run for two
comes out again and chips the slower delivery to mid-on for one
well bowled on middle and leg, no room to work with, tucked to midwicket
flat outside off stump and he cuts into the covers

dropped! Oh lord! Tossed up on leg stump, O'Brien comes out and collects it on the full, chipping in the air out to Razzak at cow corner, who backpeddles hard, gets a hand to it, lets it go and looks on as the ball rolls over the ropes...shameless stuff that!
good length outside off stump, Porterfield stands grounded and flashes the booming drive at it, missing completely
slower and wider, stays low as Porterfield again chases it and misses
tame end to his innings! Slower ball, Porterfield gets down on one knee, goes for the paddle, mistimes it, and the top-edge is gobbled up easily by short fine leg
back of a length outside off stump, nudged to backward point
back of a length, opens the face and steers it down to third man for one
good length outside off stump, pushed into the covers for him to keep strike
quick and flat, cut hard but right to backward point
poor ball, very wide down leg stump
quicker one on off stump, he cuts into the ground
well bowled, slow and full, driven back to Rafique
quicker, fuller, O'Brien makes room to drive, misses, and Rahim fumbles a stumping
quick on leg stump, tickled around the corner
full on off stump, played across the line to square leg
good ball, up there, no room to slog, and he can only drive back to Mortaza
full outside off stump, he stands leaden-footed and swishes, only to get beaten
back of a length, chopped past gulley for a quick two
back of a length, chopped to backward point this time
good length on the stumps, defended back down the track
he oversteps, a good yorker in the zone, dug out, the ball dies at his feet and they pinch a quick run
swishes at another one outside off stump and connects with wind
flat on off stump, uses his feet well to drive down towards long-on
quick and flat, hits him on the pad as he plays around it, umpire says no, was missing leg stump, then Johnston calls for the run, shouldve been out but again a Bangladeshi misses the stumps
tossed up on the stumps, he plays it back to the bowler
full and flat, flicked to mid-on
tossed up, he stands and swats that to midwicket for one
quicker on the stumps, he flicks across the pads and picks up two out to deep midwicket
banged in short, with a real grunt, and Johnston flashes the bat at it, getting a thick edge that flies high and down to third man
short again, on middle and off, he gets up on one leg and pulls to short fine leg
overpitched, he flings the bat at it, spooning it over backward point, the ball lands safely, he wants two, well run, and the 200 is up
full in the zone, he flicks across the line, in the air over midwicket, lands safely again and a diving stop from Tamim on the ropes saves the boundary
immense! Full, asking for trouble, and O'Brien tees off with a big six rows back over long-on, yowza!
short of a length outside off stump, up he goes on the toes, using the soft hands to just drop it at his feet and responds well to his captain's call for the single
tossed up outside off stump, he stands and dabs at it, getting beaten
flatter on off stump, worked to square leg for one
fired in down leg stump, he gets outside the line and swings it away, misses, gets hit on the boot
quick and short, he stands and pulls into deep midwicket, hustles well with his partner, and they pick up two, excellent running between the stumps
fired in down leg stump again, he swings, misses, runs, Rahim collects, throws, misses, what more do you need from a cricket match?
tossed up on leg stump, out he comes, chipping in the air for one out to deep midwicket
full toss outside off stump, slogged back over Mortaza's head, they run hard for two, huffing and puffing, a very tough call for the second, and O'Brien is caught well short of his crease
slow and fullish outside off stump, pushed into the covers for one
slow outside off stump, he gets down and slogs it over mid-on, the ball lands safely in front of long-on
slow and wide, he reaches out for it and sneaks it down to third man
nice! Stand and deliver from the captain, slamming a half-volley through cover and mid-off for four, admired the shot after it was hit, too
full moving down leg stump, flicked into the midwicket region for one to keep strike
flighted up on middle and off, slogged across the line, inside-edge out past square leg
tossed up outside off stump, just nudged in front of point for one
yessa, thats a biggie! Tossed up, Johnston clears the leg, eyes up the leg side, and heaves it over wide long-on with some force!
tossed up again, he doesnt get to the pitch of it but carries throuhg, spooning it up over mid-on and getting it to drop in no-man's-land

fired in on middle and leg, he turns it past square leg, runs one easily, but struggles coming back for the second and a good, low throw from deep midwicket accounts for him...no third umpire, just a nod of the head from Steve Bucknor
fired up one leg stump, swept past short fine leg for one
back of a length outside off stump, slogged towards square leg, they scamper one
full toss on leg stump, punched down to long-on, "two, two" is the call and thats precisely what they get
gone! Low full toss again, just outside off stump, and he pops that up to Nafees at cover, placed their for this very delivery, to end a captain's cameo
back of a length outside off stump, chopped to backward point for one
slower one outside off stump, the big man gets down, swings it loosely across the stumps, manages to pick the gap around the corner, and the ball dribbles over the ropes
well bowled, slower one on a length outside off stump, again he swings, misses, and scampers a bye

inn2.comm: begins with a loosener like Mortaza earlier, back of a length well wide of off stump that Tamim lets fly by
short of a length outside off stump again, Tamim chases it and the ball deviates after beating his bat
bouncer! Short-pitched on leg stump, pitches and rears up, Tamim hops up and the ball evades his head and the 'keeper too
short of a length outside off stump, up on the toes he goes, chopping straight to backward point
short of a length again, this time he rocks up tall and drives between backward point to get off the mark, well played
back of a length outside off stump, he gets across and taps it to point
this one sits up from a length on leg stump, Nafees hops up and plays it down in front of square leg awkwardly, taken by the bounce it seems
gentle loosener outside off stump, ignored by Tamim
jaffa! Pitches on a sweet length in the corridor, suckering Tamim into a loose poke at it, lunging forward, and then getting the ball to shape past the outer edge
thats too wide, Tamim chases it and doesnt connect with the wild cut
half-volley outside off stump, Tamim cracks a stylish swing at it but fails to connect
back of a length, tight on off stump, back he goes in his defence to the off
nips back off the scrambled seam, Tamim gets behind the line and defends back to Langford-Smith
back of a length, comes back into him as he gets up on the toes and keeps it down
back of a length on leg stump, tucked right to square leg
short of a length down leg stump, he looks to tuck it off the hips, ball looked like it clipped the thigh pad but Billy Bowden signals runs off the bat
short of a length on leg stump again, good bounce, Nafees hops up and turns it straight to square leg
a tad fuller now on and around off stump, Nafees gets forward and presents the full face of the bat
strays down leg again, but Nafees cant tuck him away, finding square leg
short of a good length on off stump, Nafees stands on the toes and taps it back down the pitch
slower one, just outside off stump, stays low, Tamim's feet go nowhere as he fishes and gets beaten
this one sits up off a short length outside off stump, Tamim stands and flashes the bat, beaten again
bang, short again, he fends at it and gets the edge, which lands wide of second slip
fuller now, Nafees gets forward and drives nicely to mid-off
swish! Tamim doesnt learn, stands there and flashes at one outside off stump, lucky not to draw an edge
slower, on a goodish length outside off stump, and this time Tamim leaves it alone
lands outside leg stump and carries on down, O'Brien has work to do moving to his right behind the stumps
short of a length outside off stump, played down with an angled bat to backward point
now he too chases one, kitchen sink et al, outside off stump and fails to connect
steepling bounce off a great length, not short but not driveable, Nafees is surprised, gets in line and the ball takes the handle
short of a length again, he hops up and keeps it down this time
angled down leg stump again, wide is the call, rightly
tries the short-pitched delivery again, but its way down leg side, poor bowling
back of a length outside off stump, Nafees square-drives through point for two
good length ball outside off stump, this time he comes across and shoulders arms
bounced down the leg side, Tamim gets down on the haunches as the ball sails over his left shoulder
angled across him outside off stump, Tamim stands rooted and flays at it and yes, misses again
back of a length, there's a good-looking back foot punch to a diving mid-off
short of a length again, up he goes, driving to sub John Mooney at mid-off
back of a length, quicker, outside off stump, once more Tamim's feet go nowhere as he chases it wildly
hah, again! Langford-Smith bends his back, getting this one to sit up off the seam outside off stump, and Tamim again flirts with disaster, standing up tall and flaying the bat, only to miss
good length outside off stump, Nafees stands and drives to mid-off
this one comes back in off a good length, Nafees gets behind the line and turns it to the on side
first blood! Banged in short, Nafees swivels on the pull, done in by the extra bounce as the ball darts into him, gets the glove and the ball pops up for a simple catch for the 'keeper
banged in short on leg stump, he moves and turns it in the air towards short fine leg, but safely
banged in short again on leg stump, he shapes to pull, gets glove on it and the ball rolls behind square for Aftab to get off the mark
back of a length outside off stump, in a flash he gets back and crunches a drive, well timed, but Porterfield at point flings himself to his right and cuts it off
full, away-swinging delivery outside off stump, Aftab gets a good look at it, moves across, and shoulders arms
slower ball outside off stump, now he lunges forward and drives loosely to cover
angles down leg stump, Aftab shuffles and flicks...well, sort of...but only gets pad on it to short fine leg
he tries that famous dance down the track, like he did to India's Zaheer Khan decades ago, but the bowler sees him coming, drags it short, and Tamim has to play it to cover
back of a length, no feet movement as he cracks a drive thats well stopped at mid-off, got a hand to it to take some pace of it
drifts down leg and its helped on its way down to third man
well bowled, short of a length on middle and leg, up he gets, behind the line, and defends back to Rankin
good length on off stump, back he goes, driving well to mid-off, beating his dive, and collecting runs down to long-off
full and furious on leg stump, Aftab looks to flick it into oblivion, gets a massive leading edge that balloons over cover-point for four
but thats brilliant! Again the ball was full on leg stump, and this time Aftab connects well with his lofted shot, slamming it over wide long-on for maximum, woof!
he responds with a short-pitched delivery down leg stump, Aftab pulls, misses, and wide is the call
good length well outside off stump, deviates a lot and another wide is called
back of a length outside off stump, he gets up and pushes gently into the covers and calls for the single, good stuff
another wide, poor stuff, Rankin's struggling down the leg side
charges out, not to the pitch, swings at it, and gets an inside-edge through leg that the 'keeper collects
short of a length outside off stump, driven off the back foot to McCallan at cover
bounced down the leg stump, he ducks down and allows the ball to go over
slower, fuller, and he drives it to cover
back of a length outside off stump, up he goes, connecting very well on his back-foot drive in the gap at cover, nice
oh boy, here he goes, charging down the track, bowler follows up by pitching short, and Tamim looks comical caught nowhere, flailing the bat
good follow-up, a yorker, which is dug out
gone, first ball! Full, wide, Aftab leans across, chasing it, and gets a thin edge that the 'keeper, expertly chasing the ball's pattern too, snaps up! Botha! O'Brien!
good length outside off stump, pushed to point
back of a length outside off stump, pushed to point
wider outside off stump, he drives loosely and gets a thick edge that scoots through the vacant gulley region
fuller on off stump, defended back down the track
slower one, back of a length outside off stump, he drives standing up, with one hand, and misses
overpitched outside off stump, he stands and flays a square-drive thats cut off by backward point
back of a length on middle and leg, he shuffles and turns it to midwicket, 'NO' is the call back
short of a length outside off stump again, uneven bounce, chases it and...yes, yes...misses
short of a length, kicks up, but he gets right behind the line and nudges it in front of mid-off, well played
short of a length, stands up and mistimes the cut shot, hitting into the ground hard
back of a length just on top of off stump, gets back and punches nicely to mid-off
back of a length, pushed into the off side
slow and full, nicely driven into the covers
overpitched, he gets to the pitch and drives but cant beat mid-off

full, driven back down the track, Botha sticks his right hand out, the ball kisses his fingers, Saqibul is backing up, tries to get his bat inside the line but the ball dislodges the bail a split-second before he can get it down
back of a length moving away from off stump, he stands rooted and chases it, beaten
good length outside off stump, he eases forward and pushes to Porterfield at point
good length outside off stump, away swing immediately, Ashraful leaves it be
full outside off stump, Ashraful gets forward and drives back to Johnston
good length outside off stump, gets over it and pushes to point, calling for the quick single
moves around the wicket, bowls it full, Tamim drives to cover
half-volley, down on bended knee he goes, crashing a firm drive between cover and point for a boundary, lovely to watch
back of a length outside off stump, feet go nowhere, stand and flays the bat at it, and gets beaten...oh, the two shades of Tamim
back of a length outside off stump, angled down to McCallan short third man
good length outside off stump, comes forward, holds back on the shot, and runs it past the deep slip for four, well played
moves in, fuller ball, Ashraful plays forward and back to Botha
back of a length, comes in off the seam, he gets forward, then rocks back, deliberately playing it up and wide of slip
back of a length outside off stump, goes back and across and defends, the ball rolls to point
a tad fuller, driven to cover
back of a length outside off stump, chopped to point, Ashraful calls for the run
slow and full on the stumps, defended to the on side, Johnston fields
good length outside off stump, steered off the front foot to backward point
wide of off stump, Ashraful chases it, not timed well at all, but gets enough bat on it to spoon it over backward point for four
back of a length outside off stump, steered through point for one
short of a length outside off stump, Tamim chases it and is beaten, surprise, surprise
thats outta here! Botha bowls a long-hop, and at that pace, Ashraful has little hassles, gets into position in a flash, picks it early, and pulls over square leg for six
classical! Botha follows up with a half-volley outside off stump, and he unfirls a textbook cover drive for four through the covers
good length on the stumps, and now he displays apt backfoot defence...its all happening here
overpitched again, and now he gets onto one knee, square-driving to point
good length just outside off stump, Ashraful gets behind the line of the ball, head down, and defends
well bowled, getting it to nip in significantly off a length, and he defends back to Botha
overpitched on off stump, Tamim drives, not timed perfectly but the ball beats mid-on and races away for a boundary
back of a length outside off stump, he rocks back and drives to mid-off for a quick single
good length outside off stump, he gets over it and defends into the covers
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
driveable length outside off stump, he stands and flashes the bat at it, the thick edge splices off the face of the bat behind square, and Langford-Smith dives on the third man ropes to cut off four

comes rushing down the pitch, eyeing any side of the ground he can hit it to, swings that across ferociously....and misses! The ball wasnt all that far from clipping the top of middle and leg, either!
good length on off stump, defended stoically
back of a length, waits on it and opens the face, running it down to third man for one
good length just outside off stump, he eyes it up and decides to leave, but whew, that was close to bowling him
fuller, he drives back past the bowler and Rankin from mid-off gives chase to haul it in
back of a length outside off stump, opens the face and steers it towards gulley
beaten trying to repeat the shot, a muted appeal from 'keeper O'Brien
back of a length outside off stump, played into the covers
short of a length, opens the face and runs it down to third man for one
good length outside off stump, driven to mid-off, wants the run but is wisely turned down
overpitched outside off stump, driven hard to mid-off
shot! Overpitched, he just swings the bat and slams the slower ball down to long-off for four

cleaned 'em up! Tamim backs away to leg, exposing the stumps, and Johnston chases him with a yorker that he drags onto the stumps...celebrations for the Irish captain and his wards! There's that little fancy jig he does!
tossed up, beats the bat as he comes forward to defend
tossed up, spins away this time as he comes out to graft
much better, tossed up again, and now Ashraful square-drives well in the gap for four, hit on the up, nice to see
change of pace, shorter length, he backs away to cut and gets beaten
full and flat outside off stump, he gets down and drives out to the cover sweeper
tossed up invitingly, he gets to the pitch and drives straight to cover
back of a length outside off stump, wide, Ashraful reaches across and chases it to get beaten
another loosener, well wide of off stump, and Rankin's woes continue...oh, jeez
back of a length outside off stump, he hops up and runs it off the outer edge of the bat to a moving Porterfield at backward point

close, too close! Rankin bounces one in short on the stumps, Ashraful hooks, not timed well, spliced off the bat, eyes off the ball, ball balloons up in the air for some time, there are two men out for this very shot...and the ball lands safely!
short and wide, cracked off the back foot out to third man
back of a length on off stump, he hops up, taps it to the feet, sets off, Bashar is just standing there, reacts late, and Ashraful has to dash back
back of a length again, back and across he goes, turning it to mid-on

gone! Rankin bangs one short on leg stump, Ashraful moves to hook, times it beautifully off the middle of the bat, but straight down Langford-Smith's throat at fine leg, didnt have to move an inch, well placed he was!
tossed up on off stump, driven to mid-on
short and wide, cut hard but Porterfield at backward point is a livewire, saves runs
tossed up, he comes well forward and smothers the spin
tossed up on middle and off, turned to square leg, Bashar wants the run, sent back, and just makes it
tossed up on off stump, well defended
tossed up on off stump, well defended again
bounces him over the stumps, he pulls, misses, there's a clear noise, 'keeper catches the ball, they all appeal, Bucknor is unmoved...forerarm, perhaps?
short of a length outside off stump, cut down to third man
back of a length on off stump, he hops up and defends it back to Rankin
back of a length on off stump, he hops up and defends it back again
good length outside off stump, he has a look at it and leaves it be
back of a length outside off stump, Rahim gets behind the line and pushes to point
tossed up on off stump, comes forward and drives to mid-on
tossed up, good rotations on the ball, Bashar lunges forward and defends
tossed up again,and he gets forward to defend
tossed up, this time he gets forward and drives to mid-on
fraction short, he rocks back and cuts but cant beat Mooney at cover
quicker on middle and leg, turned to square leg

dropped! Johnston drags one in short, Bashar pulls, mistimes it totally, the ball goes high, high in the air, the man placed for this shot out in the deep, Langford-Smith, runs in, grabs for it as the ball dies on him, and makes a hash of it
back of a length, driven to mid-on
back of a length again, pushed to midwicket for one
full on middle and off, pushed to mid-on, cant beat the man there
good length outside off stump, nudged into the covers, where Mooney doesnt collect it well
slower one, really wide, he reaches out and steers it to Porterfield at backward point
flat on middle and off, turned to square leg
he comes out, fired in quicker, worked to midwicket
full and flat on off stump, chipped out to midwicket for one
quicker on middle and off, turned right to midwicket
flat, no pace, he goes back and drives back to the bowler
fuller outside off stump, Bashar drives to mid-on
drifts down leg, tickled out to Langford-Smith at fine leg
back of a length on off stump, comes in, Bashar plays it to midwicket
fuller delivery outside off stump, nicely driven to mid-off
short of a length, pulled to midwicket
back of a length on the stumps, tickled around the corner for one
dragged in short again, pulled out to midwicket
tossed up, driven to mid-on
flat on middle and off, turned to short fine leg
full on leg stump, flicked out to deep square leg
flat and shorter, he shuffles across and nudges it to square leg
full on off stump, driven down to long-on
tossed up on middle and leg, paddled around the corner and a misfield gets them one
back of a length on the stumps, he looks to nudge it to leg but doesnt time it well, Rahim says no run, boss
short one again, Bashar pulls loosely over midwicket, no power in that shot, lands safely in the deep
short of a length, Rahim hops up and edges it along the ground to backward point
short and wide, teh ball sits up, Rahim cracks a firm cut past point, and a tag-team effort on the ropes, White and Bray, combine well for the fielding effort
back of a length on the stumps, he hops up and defends
short and wide again, cut well but Porterfield stops it at backward point
flat on off stump, driven down to long-on for one
tossed up, Rahim gives him the charge, getting well to the pitch and since the fielder was up, he cashes in with over mid-off
nice shot! Fraction short and wide, Rahim now rocks back and cuts, placing it well in the gap and thats eight in two

comeback, and how! McCallan strikes back in classical offspinner's fashion! Fingers roll over the seam, tosses it up, deceives Rahim totally in the flight, beaten by the spin and the balls sneaks through to disturb the furniture! Beauty!
tossed up on middle and off, tucked straight to square leg
flatter down leg stump, he looks to work it fine but doesnt get bat on it
short and wide, firmly cut out to deep point for a single
hah, caught and bowled to get rid of Mortaza! An innocuous delivery, a slow full toss, that he just tamely pushes back to the bowler!
from around the wicket to the left-hander, back of a length, pushed to point
shorter one outside off stump, he stands up and plays it in the air in the gap between point and extra cover
short-pitched, he pulls through square for one
good length, he goes back and pushes to cover
tossed up on off stuump, driven back to the bowler
floated through on off stump, Bashar takes a step down and pushes it back to McCallan
McCallan loops in invitingly outside th off stump, Bashar leans forward and drives through covers
McCallan angles it into Rafique from round the wicket, Rafique pushes forward and defends
pushed into the covers on the front foot
outstanding fielding from Porterfield, Bashar moves on the back foot and plays it to mid-on, Porterfield is stationed wide in the circle, he moves across in a flash and dives to his left to save runs
pushed to cover on the front foot
short of a length on off and middle stump, Rafique jumps back in his crease and blocks
Langford-Smith bowls it full and angles it into Rafique's middle and leg stump, the batsman plays back and defends back to the bowler

caught! Johnston takes it at midwicket, Langford-Smith bangs it short, Rafique moves on to the back foot and plays a feeble pull, the ball lobs towards midwicket where Johnston runs backwards to his right and takes it over his shoulder, Ireland inch closer to a famous and thoroughly well-deserved victory
full ball outside off stump, Razzak squeezes it out behind point for a single
Langford-Smith fires in the yorker on middle and leg stump, Bashar clips it to midwicket
good length ball on middle and leg, Razzak gets beaten and is hit on the pad
defended to point on the back foot
that's good length and wide outside off stump, Razzak flashes at it and gets beaten
fuller on middle and leg, Razzak turns it straight to the fielder at short midwicket
full outside off stump, driven out to deep point
full and slow, he stands and chases it, only to get beaten
low full toss on off stump, flashed at and the inside-edge carries it to fine leg
slower one, full outside off stump, driven to mid-off
yorker-length ball on leg stump, clipped down to fine leg
short of a length on middle and leg, tickled to short fine leg for one
short-pitched outside off stump, pulled along the ground through square leg for a single
yorker, almost, on off stump thats driven back to Langford-Smith
drifts down leg stump, turned to short fine leg
overpitched, driven back down the ground past the umpire to long-off
good length on off stump, driven via the inside-edge to square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged off the pads into the vacant spot behind square
good length on off stump, defended back down the track
back of a length outside off stump, chopped late down to Langford-Smith at third man
full and wide, he drives and edges down to the third man ropes, his first boundary, and thats his highest score of the tournament
full on off stump, gets over it and flicks to midwicket
short of a length, he gets up and mistimes the pull into the ground near his feet
short and wide, rising on him, but he cuts well behind backward point for a single to third man
too full, too wide down leg stump
banged in short down leg stump, Razzak hooks it down to fine leg for one
wide, short delivery outside off stump, Bashar isnt going after it
back of a length on off stump, defended back down the track to complete a fine spell from the burly medium-pacer
fuller on middle and leg, flicked to square leg, Mooney fumbles and allows a run
back of a length, he goes back and defends, inside-edge to short fine leg
good length outside off stump, steered to backward point
back of a length outside off stump, he goes back and hammers it down past the stumps to long-off
quicker, fuller, outside leg stump, raps him and Botha asks - nay, yells - the question but Bowden says nope
full and wide, and Razzak drives in the air over point for one out to the sweeper
back of a length, pitches and seams away, squaring him up, balls clips the glove and runs wide of the 'keeper
fuller on off stump, Bashar lunges over it, gets an inside-edge to midwicket, sets off, then sends Razzak back when he's well down the track, but Mooney from mid-on cant hit the stumps
shorter one, pulled uneasily through square
fuller on off stump, played to midwicket for one, the ball bobbed up and landed safely
wayward delivery down leg stump
overpitched, Bashar drives back to Johnston on the bounce
another slow, dibbly one down leg stump
short and wide, he cuts, Porterfield dives, cant stop it, its in the gap and runs away for four
tossed up, he swings across the line to midwicket
flatter, he comes out and swings again, inside-edging onto his boot
quicker, spins into him and he just manages to get bat on it, chopping to point

bowled! You-miss-I-hit kinda stuff! McCallan changes the pace, firing it in quicker on leg stump, Razzak exposes the stumps, swings at it, misses, and the base of leg stump is hit. Ireland one wicket away from their second win over Test-level competition
tossed up on off stump, defended
tossed up, spins away from his forward prod
good length outside off stump, he gets forward and just pushes to cover
all over! Johnston clears up Bashar, captain to captain, with a good length delivery on off stump, that sneaks past his ugly swipe and castles him! Ireland win by 74 runs and the crown erupts!
